items.title: IPO-bound Tata Capital profit more than doubles to Rs 1,041-crore in June quarter
items.description: In the same quarter last year, the IPO-bound company had reported a profit of Rs 472.21 crore. Total income rose to Rs 7,691.65 crore for the quarter under review from Rs 6,557.40 crore in the April-June quarter of FY2025

items.title: The Power of the Pivot: Recognising and reversing organisational decay
items.description: Organisations, like individuals, can decline through small shifts -- mediocrity, procrastination, and failure to execute. Leaders must recognise these signs early, enforce standards, streamline decisions, and commit to disciplined execution for sustained growth

items.title: Trump's tariff may hit Indian banks' corporate loan growth: Report
items.description: Trump imposed a base tariff of 25 percent and an additional levy of 25 percent for buying Russian oil

items.title: Power posted a mixed quarter after early monsoon cut demand, but here’s why hopes of a recovery ride high
items.description: Margins in coal and regulated businesses slipped on lower incentives while renewable margins improved on better PLF and cost control.

items.title: IBC Rewired: Practical fixes for a complex economy
items.description: Nearly a decade of insolvency law’s operation has shown that there are loopholes in its design which limit its potential benefit. The recently introduced amendment bill seeks to resolves key jurisprudential conflicts, streamline procedures, and empower creditors

items.title: Royal Orchid Hotels: Should you buy this hotel stock?
items.description: ROHL is aggressively expanding presence, and, under Vision 2030, it is targeting 3x reach in hotel properties and 2.3x reach in hotel keys

items.title: Emami: Why this niche FMCG stock merits attention, post correction
items.description: Rural stronghold, and higher premium mix will give fillip to growth, margins

items.title: Inside PVR Inox’s popcorn strategy: Driving F&B spends amid weak box office in FY25
items.description: In addition to F&B in cinemas, the company went beyond the four walls of the cinema by entering outdoor catering and corporate events.
